importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article update reflects the current state of the MLB postseason, highlighting real-time developments in the NLCS and ALCS as they unfold.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The current date marks the conclusion of Game 4 of the NLCS and Game 4 of the ALCS, with both series in critical moments, setting up potential World Series matchups.

keyTakeAways: The Los Angeles Dodgers have a 3-0 lead in the NLCS against the Milwaukee Brewers and are one win away from a second consecutive World Series appearance, making them the first defending champion to do so in 16 years.
The Toronto Blue Jays have tied the Seattle Mariners in the ALCS after outscoring them 21-6 in Games 3 and 4, with the series now level, raising the stakes for both teams.
Max Scherzer, 41, delivered a strong performance in Game 4 of the ALCS, allowing only two runs and three hits in 5 2/3 innings, while Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit a fifth playoff home run.
Jacob Misiorowski pitched a stellar game for the Brewers, striking out nine – a rookie postseason record – keeping the NLCS tight until the Dodgers scored in the sixth and seventh innings.
The Dodgers have a 8-1 postseason record, with their only loss being against the Philadelphia Phillies in the NLDS.
The Blue Jays are now in a pivotal position in the ALCS, having won their first four games as the road team, and are hoping to take the series lead for the first time.
The Dodgers’ second straight World Series appearance would be a historic milestone, as no team has achieved back-to-back titles since the Yankees in 1998–2000.
The Phillies were the last team to reach the World Series as a defending champion in 2009, underscoring the rarity of this achievement.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Los Angeles
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are in the midst of a historic postseason run, with a 3-0 lead in the NLCS and one win away from achieving a second consecutive World Series appearance, a feat last accomplished in 2009 by the Phillies and not since the Yankees in 1998–2000.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Milwaukee
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers are facing the Dodgers in the NLCS with a 3-0 series deficit, and their pitcher Jacob Misiorowski delivered a standout performance, striking out nine in a tight game that the Dodgers ultimately won.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Philadelphia
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies were the last team to reach the World Series as a defending champion in 2009, setting the historical benchmark for what the Dodgers are now attempting to achieve in a second consecutive appearance.

namedEntities.name: Boston Red Sox
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Boston
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Red Sox are referenced as the only team to win a best-of-seven series after losing the first three games, highlighting the statistical rarity of teams holding a 3-0 lead and going on to win.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Seattle
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners are facing the Toronto Blue Jays in the ALCS with a 2-0 series deficit, and the Blue Jays are now tied after winning Games 3 and 4, making the series highly competitive.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Toronto
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are now tied in the ALCS after outscoring the Mariners 21-6 in Games 3 and 4, with momentum and a chance to take the series lead, making them a key player in the postseason narrative.

namedEntities.name: Max Scherzer
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Scherzer played a pivotal role in Game 4 of the ALCS, allowing only two runs in 5 2/3 innings and contributing to the Blue Jays' momentum, showcasing elite performance in a critical playoff game.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A MLB player and current member of the Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Guerrero Jr. hit his fifth home run in the playoffs during Game 4 of the ALCS, contributing significantly to the Blue Jays' offensive surge and helping them tie the series.

namedEntities.name: Jacob Misiorowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Milwaukee Brewers pitcher and a rookie
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Misiorowski struck out nine batters, setting a Milwaukee rookie postseason record, and helped keep the NLCS game tight until the Dodgers scored in the sixth and seventh innings.

namedEntities.name: Tommy Edman
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Edman hit an RBI single in the sixth inning, helping the Dodgers take the lead, and later celebrated the team's momentum, citing it as a turning point in the series.

namedEntities.name: Freddie Freeman
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Freeman scored on a throwing error by Abner Uribe, contributing to the Dodgers’ 3-1 lead and helping seal the victory in Game 4 of the NLCS.

namedEntities.name: Abner Uribe
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Uribe committed a throwing error that allowed Freddie Freeman to score, directly impacting the outcome of the game and contributing to the Dodgers' 3-1 lead.

namedEntities.name: CNN
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The article was published by CNN, providing widespread public access to live updates on MLB postseason developments, enhancing global awareness of the drama unfolding in the NLCS and ALCS.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Los Angeles Dodgers are one win away from securing a second consecutive World Series appearance after defeating the Milwaukee Brewers 3-1 in Game 4 of the NLCS, with a 3-0 series lead and only a single win remaining. The Dodgers' historic run positions them as the first defending champion to reach the World Series in 16 years, following the 2009 Phillies, and mirrors the Yankees’ back-to-back titles in 1998–2000. Meanwhile, in the ALCS, the Toronto Blue Jays have tied the Seattle Mariners after outscoring them 21-6 in Games 3 and 4, with the series now level. Max Scherzer and Vladimir Guerrero Jr. played pivotal roles in the Blue Jays’ victory, while Brewers rookie Jacob Misiorowski delivered a standout performance with nine strikeouts. The article highlights the high stakes of both series, with both the Dodgers and Blue Jays on the brink of World Series berths, and underscores the rarity of such postseason achievements in modern baseball.
title: Dodgers close in on second straight World Series appearance, Blue Jays knot up ALCS against Mariners
